snippet: An official from a European group of retailers claimed that American retailers were trying to avoid paying for safety improvements at factories and criticized an inspection effort by Walmart.
abstract: Tensions break into open involving two large groups of retailers--one overwhelmingly American, the other dominated by Europeans--that have formed to improve garment factory safety in Bangladesh; Europeans claim that Americans are trying to avoid paying for improvements and criticize independent inspection effort by Walmart.
lead_paragraph: An official from a European group of retailers claimed that American retailers were trying to avoid paying for safety improvements at factories and criticized an inspection effort by Walmart.

headline.main: Europeans Fault American Safety Effort in Bangladesh
headline.print_headline: Europeans Fault American Safety Effort in Bangladesh
